paragraph.paragraph: Debugging is the process of tracing the execution of your project while it is running, to find any bugs that are occurring in the project. This is achieved by stepping through the project's source code, line by line, and comparing the actual execution of the project with the desired execution. When anomalies are found, they cannot be fixed until the debugging process is ended as you must end the debugging in order to edit the source code of the project and recompile. This process will often be repeated until all known bugs are found.

There are many aspects of the Visual Studio .NET Debugger, which EiffelEnvision seamlessly plugs into so you may debug projects written in EiffelEnvision in Visual Studio .NET. The documentation on the Visual Studio .NET debugger, how to use it and all of its facades can be found in the
_asug_How_Do_I_Topics3a_Debugging 0 Using the Debugger documentation.
For information on starting debugger sessions for projects within Visual Studio .NET, please refer to the documentation on vchowExecutionControl 0 Execution Control .

When debugging EiffelEnvision projects, using one of the many debugger windows ( vcurfWatchWindow 0 Watch , vcurfLocalsWindow 0 Locals , vcurfAutosWindow 0 Autos , etc.) the Type column will also show the Eiffel-name of a .NET type. In ../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/index.xml Eiffel for .NET, Eiffel classes are always in upper case. To ensure Eiffel and Eiffel for .NET remain the same language, a formatting algorithm is applied on types and ../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xml features from ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/adding_references/index.xml referenced components to ensure they are consistent with the ../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/index.xml Eiffel Conventions. More information can be found on the formatting for .NET types and features in ../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/90_assembly_formatting.xmlReferenced Assembly Type and Feature Name Conversion.
